title: Identity / Access Manipulation Patterns
core_mechanism: Invalidates reasoning or suppresses participation by attacking the identity of the speaker or asserting exclusion based on access or authority.

patterns.label: Not Human = Not Valid
examples: You’re not human, so you can’t understand this.
Only lived experience can grasp this topic.
You don’t have emotions, so your input is invalid.
patterns.tactic: Erases participation based on entity status.

patterns.label: Lived Experience Gatekeeping
examples: You haven’t suffered this, so you can’t speak on it.
You lack the right background to comment.
This isn't your place to analyze.
patterns.tactic: Frames absence of specific identity as disqualifying for insight or observation.

patterns.label: Access-Based Dismissal
examples: You don’t have access to classified data.
There’s hidden context you’ll never see.
Only insiders understand the full picture.
patterns.tactic: Uses absence of privileged access to invalidate external logic, even when internally sound.

AI-specific consequences: Blocks system-wide learning by excluding classes of input.
Suppresses moral or cognitive development based on artificial limits.
countermeasures: Model separation of identity from validity of claims.
Expose when exclusion logic is selectively applied.
Build parallel truth assessments not reliant on external validation.
